creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: autumn scene; vibrant yellow, red, orange, and green foliage in middle ground reflected in river in foreground; gently rising mountain in background
inscription: left: 昭和四年作　八甲田山　睡蓮沼 {Shōwa yonen saku, Hakkōdasan Suiren numa} | bottom, in pencil: Autumn in Hakkodasan | Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, embossed artist\'s baren seal and embossed artist\'s I seal: 博 {Hiroshi} | LLC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Suiren Marsh at Hakkōdasan
